intro: Verbesina benderi, commonly known as the Mexican beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are hairy and have a serrated edge, while the stems are often covered in fine, sticky hairs. Verbesina benderi is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
